intro: Gaura heterandra, commonly known as the narrowleaf gaura, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and natural landscapes. Its delicate appearance and easy maintenance contribute to its appeal among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
